etymology.description: Left radical form of 衣(衣) (yī, 'clothing') -> used as radical for clothing-related characters
etymology.interpretation: 衤 is a simplified component derived from 衣(衣) (yī, 'clothing'), representing the left radical associated with clothing. It indicates the association with clothing in characters where it appears.

examples.chinese: 他穿上了一件漂亮的衤(衣)。
examples.pinyin: Tā chuān shàng le yī jiàn piàoliang de yī.
examples.english: He put on a beautiful piece of clothing.

examples.chinese: 博物馆里展出古代衤(衣)，展示传统工艺(展示傳統工藝)。
examples.pinyin: Bówùguǎn lǐ zhǎnchū gǔdài yī, zhǎnshì chuántǒng gōngyì.
examples.english: The museum displays ancient clothing and exhibits traditional craftsmanship.
